title: Number of animals in the refinement tracklets step  does not coincide with the number of animals specified in the GUI
body:
OS: Windows 10
DeepLabCut Version: 2.2rc1
Anaconda env used: DLC-GPU

Describe the problem:

I'm using the GUI with the new version of DLC (I have a single animal) and in the Refine Tracklets step, even if the number of animals is specified 1, when I refine tracklets I have 2 individuals popping out (at some point the detections change color, detecting 2 animals on the same animal) 


**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66062281/120196749-e1efc680-c228-11eb-8504-a86afa375edf.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66062281/120196775-e9af6b00-c228-11eb-989b-ffad3974cf26.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66062281/120197160-5c204b00-c229-11eb-8bd5-05146011456c.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66062281/120197240-6c382a80-c229-11eb-832e-3b7380fd4882.png)

I want to add that I also have problems in the plotting section. I have a Key error in pandas.

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Users\ephys\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexes\base.py", line 3080, in get_loc
    return self._engine.get_loc(casted_key)
  File "pandas\_libs\index.pyx", line 70, in pandas._libs.index.IndexEngine.get_loc
  File "pandas\_libs\index.pyx", line 101, in pandas._libs.index.IndexEngine.get_loc
  File "pandas\_libs\hashtable_class_helper.pxi", line 4554, in pandas._libs.hashtable.PyObjectHashTable.get_item
  File "pandas\_libs\hashtable_class_helper.pxi", line 4562, in pandas._libs.hashtable.PyObjectHashTable.get_item
KeyError: 'mouseDserine'

The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Users\ephys\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\gui\create_videos.py", line 363, in create_videos
    track_method=self.trackertypes.GetValue(),
  File "C:\Users\ephys\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\utils\plotting.py", line 279, in plot_trajectories
    linewidth=linewidth,
  File "C:\Users\ephys\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\utils\plotting.py", line 51, in PlottingResults
    Dataframe = Dataframe.loc(axis=1)[:, individuals2plot]
  File "C:\Users\ephys\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexing.py", line 889, in __getitem__
    return self._getitem_tuple(key)
  File "C:\Users\ephys\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexing.py", line 1060, in _getitem_tuple
    return self._getitem_lowerdim(tup)
  File "C:\Users\ephys\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexing.py", line 787, in _getitem_lowerdim
    return self._getitem_axis(tup, axis=axis)
  File "C:\Users\ephys\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexing.py", line 1117, in _getitem_axis
    locs = labels.get_locs(key)
  File "C:\Users\ephys\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexes\multi.py", line 3305, in get_locs
    self.get_loc_level(k, level=i, drop_level=False)[0]
  File "C:\Users\ephys\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexes\multi.py", line 2965, in get_loc_level
    return self._get_loc_level(key, level=level, drop_level=drop_level)
  File "C:\Users\ephys\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexes\multi.py", line 3068, in _get_loc_level
    indexer = self._get_level_indexer(key, level=level)
  File "C:\Users\ephys\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexes\multi.py", line 3158, in _get_level_indexer
    idx = self._get_loc_single_level_index(level_index, key)
  File "C:\Users\ephys\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexes\multi.py", line 2809, in _get_loc_single_level_index
    return level_index.get_loc(key)
  File "C:\Users\ephys\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexes\base.py", line 3082, in get_loc
    raise KeyError(key) from err
KeyError: 'mouseDserine'


'mouseDserine' being the only individual in the config file.

 Thank you for the help!
